chapter.title: Interceptors
chapter.para: The subject of this chapter, Interceptors, allow you to override/ extend the default behaviour of Baritus.

sect1.title: Interception
sect1.para: Interceptors provide a means to encapsulate cross-cutting code that is executed on pre-defined points in the line of execution. Interceptors are classes that implement one or more interfaces from the packages 'nl.openedge.baritus.interceptors' and 'nl.openedge.baritus.interceptors.flow'.

There are two kinds of interceptors. The first type are interceptors that can be used to 'enrich' de model (formBeanContext), eg. load data, save session attributes, etc. The second type of interceptors are interceptors that can have an effect on the flow. These 'flow interceptors' can overrule the command (perform method) and redirect to another view. The latter type can be used to work with multi page forms coupled to one command or for instances implementing a generic 'system error' type of view.
The first type of interceptors are allways called before the second type. Besides that, the interception points are exactely the same for both types.

sect1.title: Normal interceptors
sect1.para: This type of interceptors are used to add behaviour without having an influence on the flow of execution.

sect1.title: Flow interceptors
sect1.para: Flow interceptors can influence the flow of execution.
